fields.description:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/ADM-4833

Please update the dependancy on jaxb-impl to 

{noformat}
<dependency>
  <groupId>com.sun.xml.bind</groupId>
  <artifactId>jaxb-impl</artifactId>
  <version>2.1</version>
  <classifier>EA1</classifier>
</dependency>
{noformat}

This is necessary because this artefact uses the little used <classifier /> syntax and cannot be referenced correctly without this. When we switched from archiva to nexus this stopped working because someone had hand installed this artefact (without the -EA1 name) into archivas cache.

The correct solution to this is to specify the artefact fully, which will allow it to be referenced correctly from the central maven repo.
fields.summary: jaxb-impl dependancy incorrect in atlassian-fisheye-dependencies-2.1.0-SNAPSHOT.pom

fields.description:
Add support for the Surround SCM Source Control software made by SeaPine.

The Surround SCM website can be found here: http://www.seapine.com/scmbenefits.html

I am unsure if they provide a direct API that can be used for intergration, but they do provide a client that can be used for scripting, and I believe offer web access to the repositories. 

Surround is a proprietary SCM system.
fields.summary: Jira Source Control integration with Surround SCM

fields.summary: we need a plugin that shows where all the UI plugin points are

fields.description: We currently use Hunks in two different ways --- when we get diffs from an scm they're in universal diff format (1-based, with exceptions), but when we calculate diffs internally the Hunks are zero-based.  This is confusing and unnecessarily complicated.  It would be better to always have the hunks be zero-based and translate from universal diff format on Hunk creation if necessary.  Switching to this approach would require creating an upgrade task to update the stored diff hunks in infdb, which are currently in universal diff format.
fields.summary: Standardise the usage of Hunk.java

Add JAXB java beans to wadl and generated html

Make the Jersey xml stylesheet respect html in javadoc

fields.description:
Repository structure:
- trunk
- branches
- tags
- newfolder

Steps to reproduce:
# Move {{/branches}} to new directory {{/newfolder/branches}}
# In Fisheye, set the excludes to branches/FILEs e.g branches/sam*
{noformat}
<repository store-diff="true" description="" name="Devroot" enabled="true">
      <svn command-timeout="" follow-base="false" initial-import="none" path="newfolder" url="file:///c:/devroot"><symbolic auto-rules="true"/></svn>

      <allow><exclude casesensitive="false" pattern="branches/sam*"/></allow><security><required-groups/></security>
</repository>
{noformat}
# Fisheye still showing the excluded files. See the sample screen shot
# However, the excludes work if the path="newfolder" is removed.

I have attached the svndump to reproduce the issue.
fields.summary: Excludes doesn't work well with path

fields.description:
We would like to replace com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnLogMessage with our own implementation.

We do this as we use svn commit hooks to replace the author with a human readable name, and store the actual author username in a new custom svn property.

Ideally we'd like to use the plugin framework to replace com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnLogMessage with our own.
fields.summary: Allow plugable Subversion parser

fields.description:
If the user name contains non-ASCII characters, they are printed improperly in {{<TITLE>}} tag of the page. However ,the content of the page prints the name properly.

The {{&}} sign gets replaced with {{&}}.

E.g.
{code}
...
        <title>Grzegorz Ol&#281;dzki Home</title>
...
{code}

instead of 
{code}
...
        <title>Grzegorz Olędzki Home</title>
...
{code}
fields.summary: & gets replaced with & in <TITLE> of FishEye pages

fields.description: Currently if we need to calculate the blame or annotation for a file (when calculating author blame in slurp or viewing an annotated file/diff), we need to step through the complete history of the file from when it was added.  Strategically caching the annotation will speed up these operations.  One option would be to cache the information every N revisions, which would give us an upper bound for the operation without having to cache every file revision.
fields.summary: strategically cache file revision annotation information

fields.description:
about a year ago we changed auth method for our SVN repo, as a result the way the user names are logged is different as of x point, this really hasent been a problem but as our usage of fisheye it would be nicer to be able to map these.

Using the old auth method the user names were stored in the form <domain>\<username>, since we moved to the new method (crowd) it is just stored as <username>

It may be possible but i cant see it, is there an easy way (short of writing a script to change and the revprops and reindexing) to map the old user name format to the new one other then creating all the mappings manually?
fields.summary: Wildcard User Mapping

fields.description:
The QuartzManager needs to be exposed to plugins through the internal API.
In this process we may want to increase the level of abstraction by hiding the Quartz-specific classes that are now exposed in the QuartzManager interface, so we don't tie plugins into a specific version of quartz (and allow us to switch implementations more easily in the future).

Also, the methods that go into the API should prevent users from manipulating jobs in the SYSTEM group.

non-persistent, periodic callbacks same as in confluence

detailed plan by Tues next week

fields.description:
Currently our organization is running 100 user license 
•	Crucible 1.6.5.a with FishEye 1.6.5.a (build-357 2008-12-24) 
•	with Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_14-b03, mixed mode, sharing)
•	on CentOS release 4.5 (Final) -  2.6.9-55.0.2.ELsmp #1 SMP Tue Jun 26 14:30:58 EDT 2007 i686 i686 i386 GNU/Linux

We are encountering a svn:author constraint issue where list of commits do not appear 
when we select an author from the drop down box 

The cause of this problem is because svn:author in our repository contains comma.
The format we use for svn:author is <last name>, <first name> (uid)
Our rational for using this format is uid by itself is not informative who the actual author is without doing a lookup.

Test scenario to reproduce the problem

1)	Create repository
$ svnadmin create /tmp/test
$ cp  /tmp/test/hooks/pre-revprop-change{.tmpl,}
$ chmod +x /tmp/test/hooks/pre-revprop-change
$ sed -i 's/svn:log/svn:author/g' /tmp/test/hooks/pre-revprop-change
$ svn mkdir -m "mkdir with svn:author w/o comma" file:///tmp/test/test1
$ svn mkdir -m "mkdir with svn:author comma" file:///tmp/test/test2
$ svn propset --revprop -r 2 svn:author "Vitayaudom, Valdis (c197472)" file:///tmp/test
$ svn mkdir -m "mkdir with svn:author with space and open/close parenthesis" file:///tmp/test/test3
$  svn propset --revprop -r 3 svn:author "Vitayaudom Valdis (c197472)" file:///tmp/test

$ svn log file:///tmp/test                             
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r3 | Vitayaudom Valdis (c197472) | 2009-08-26 11:32:09 -0400 (Wed, 26 Aug 2009) | 1 line

mkdir with svn:author with space and open/close parenthesis
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r2 | Vitayaudom, Valdis (c197472) | 2009-08-26 11:04:12 -0400 (Wed, 26 Aug 2009) | 1 line

mkdir with svn:author comma
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r1 | c197472 | 2009-08-26 11:02:09 -0400 (Wed, 26 Aug 2009) | 1 line

mkdir with svn:author w/o comma
------------------------------------------------------------------------

2)	Setup fisheye to test repository

3)	View browser result

a.	svn:author constraint works for drop down box "c197472"
http://fisheye.kestrel.travelport.com/browse/~author=c197472/test-fisheye-filter-where-comma-in-svn-author

b.	svn:author constraint FAILS for drop down box "vitayaudom, valdis (c197472)" due to comma %2C
http://fisheye.kestrel.travelport.com/browse/~author=vitayaudom%2C%20valdis%20%28c197472%29/test-fisheye-filter-where-comma-in-svn-author

c.	svn:author constraint works for drop down box "vitayaudom valdis (c197472)" without comma
http://fisheye.kestrel.travelport.com/browse/~author=vitayaudom%20valdis%20%28c197472%29/test-fisheye-filter-where-comma-in-svn-author
fields.summary: any comma in the field for svn:author is preventing author constraint drop down from functional properly

...
{code}
fields.summary: FE does not display special characters in html header and tab header

fields.description:
If you have a name such as rändomName.txt in your svn repository, then you will get the following error when you try and index your repository in fisheye:

{noformat}
2009-08-17 14:13:14,617 ERROR [InitialPinger1] fisheye.app RepositoryScanner-slurp - Problem processing revisions from repo file:///home/svn/REPOBNAME/PROJECTNAME due to class com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.DbException - Problem getting diff information for rev25773
com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.DbException: Problem getting diff information for rev25773
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryScanner.slurpRevisionBlock(SvnRepositoryScanner.java:417)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.processRevisions(RepositoryScanner.java:385)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.slurpRepository(RepositoryScanner.java:265)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.slurp(RepositoryScanner.java:185)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.ping(RepositoryScanner.java:118)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryEngine.doSlurp(SvnRepositoryEngine.java:68)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.OneOffPingRequest.doRequest(OneOffPingRequest.java:30)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.PingRequest.process(PingRequest.java:90)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.processPingRequests(RepositoryHandle.java:120)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.queuePingRequest(RepositoryHandle.java:110)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.PingRequest.run(PingRequest.java:57)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Caused by: com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.SvnDiffException: Exception walking dir for /PROJECTNAME/branches@25773
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.processOutsideCopy(DiffProcessor.java:574)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.processMessage(DiffProcessor.java:281)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffFetcher.process(DiffFetcher.java:64)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffFetcher.run(DiffFetcher.java:45)
	... 1 more
Caused by: com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException: Failed to get properties for /home/crucible-2.0.2/var/tmp/REPONAME/FEImport5109301375232247171.tmp/some/path/tp/r?domName.txt:25773
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient.properties(SvnThrottledClient.java:233)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.addNewFileChangeInfoWC(DiffProcessor.java:651)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.addWCInfo(DiffProcessor.java:584)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.access$200(DiffProcessor.java:42)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor$1.visitWorkingCopyEntry(DiffProcessor.java:566)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.visitLocalCheckout(RepositoryWalker.java:207)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.visitLocalCheckout(RepositoryWalker.java:230)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.visitLocalCheckout(RepositoryWalker.java:230)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.visitLocalCheckout(RepositoryWalker.java:230)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.visitLocalCheckout(RepositoryWalker.java:230)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.visitLocalCheckout(RepositoryWalker.java:230)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.visitLocalCheckout(RepositoryWalker.java:230)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.visitLocalCheckout(RepositoryWalker.java:230)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.visitLocalCheckout(RepositoryWalker.java:230)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.visitLocalCheckout(RepositoryWalker.java:230)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.visitLocalCheckout(RepositoryWalker.java:230)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.visitLocalCheckout(RepositoryWalker.java:230)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.checkOutAndWalk(RepositoryWalker.java:184)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.walkBranchesDir(RepositoryWalker.java:168)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.walkDir(RepositoryWalker.java:88)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.processOutsideCopy(DiffProcessor.java:572)
	... 4 more
Caused by: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: '/home/crucible-2.0.2/var/tmp/REPONAME/FEImport5109301375232247171.tmp/some/path/tp/r?domName.txt' is not under version control
	at org.tigris.subversion.javahl.JavaHLObjectFactory.throwException(JavaHLObjectFactory.java:777)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.javahl.SVNClientImpl.throwException(SVNClientImpl.java:1850)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.javahl.SVNClientImpl.properties(SVNClientImpl.java:1176)
{noformat}

This appears to be a bug within svnkit. Subversion represents RändomName.txt in a filename as La(umlaut char)nder-IDs.txt and svnkit does not handle thati.e. rather than a single char for the a with umlaut,  it is 2 chars - a regular a and then an umlaut char
fields.summary: Fisheye cannot index file names with UTF-8 characters such as rändomName.txt

fields.description:
I raised this via the submit a support issue admin page in FE/CR and was told "You Support Request was submitted SUCCESSFULLY. You should recieve an email confirming the case creatation. You can log into our online support system to view the case". However, I have not received the email nor does the issue appear in the list of recent issues in the FE project on jira.atlassian.com. Therefore I am manually raising the issue now and thus it may be a duplicate if the previously submitted report ever turns up.

----

Tip: This issue looks similar to FE-1787 but the stack trace is not identical.

We are currently experiencing a very reproducible problem whereby a user either creates a new review or closes an existing review and then visits either their dashboard (/cru/) or the project summary page for the reviewed project (e.g. /cru/browse/PROJ-NAME) and then sees the exception quoted below.

Note: Not all project summary pages are affected. Visiting some other project summary pages works fine.

Exception:

{noformat}
ERROR - /cru/

* crucible-p4-scm-plugin
* crucible-confluence-scm-plugin
* crucible-filesystem-scm-plugin
* crucible-svn-scm-plugin
fields.summary: NPE on dashboard or project summary page after close or create review

fields.description:
I'm using AJP authentication (AuthType basic) and it's failing to auth with the message:

2009-08-20 12:01:48,242 WARN  [btpool0-28] fisheye.app com.cenqua.fisheye.user.UserManager-loginWithSanitizedUserName - cannot authenticate user jstiefel because user's auth type 5 is not configured

Can't find anything in the docs or google that is leading me anywhere on resolving this.

thanks!
fields.summary: AJP authentication fails with message "cannot authenticate user jstiefel because user's auth type 5 is not configured"

fields.description:
The chart shows my FE loc as contrib loc. Observed on trunk @ r42077.

http://img.skitch.com/20090819-n7p7d1jaq17ury3f9d12y51qsh.jpg
fields.summary: Loc Chart on home page shows incorrect legend

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

1) Say you have repository with trunk and branches directory. The trunk contains several files, including build.xml 
2) Create a branch (say 1.0) in your branches directory which is copy of trunk (commit, say revision 10)
3) Modify the build.xml file (commit, say revision 11)
4) Point your fisheye repository to the repository with path branches (so it does not include trunk). 
5) Define a excludes for this repository of 

{noformat}
**/*.xml
{noformat}

The first commit for this fisheye repository will be the copy (revision 10). Revision 11 will not show up (as expected as we have excluded xml files) however the changeset 10, still includes the build.xml file.
fields.summary: Excludes do not work on checkouts

fields.description: Within Fisheye, clicking the email icon will subscribe one to email notifications of changes.  These emails have '[Crucible]' in the subject.  Since these emails are unrelated to reviews, and were triggered from Fisheye, they should be titled '[Fisheye]'.
fields.summary: Email subject should say '[Fisheye]', not '[Crucible]'

fields.description:
Wrapping of long lines fails for jira issues.

http://www.ubuntu-pics.de/bild/22209/screenshot_009_oPbF70.png
fields.summary: Activity stream wrapping problem

fields.description:
When an administrator deletes a repository in Fisheye, the [fisheyedata]/var/cache/[repoisitory] directory is not removed.
This leaves a large amount of data on the disk.

- Add option to delete cache on repository removal


Short term resolution is to do a directory scan of [fisheyedata]/var/cache/ and compare against repositories found in the config.xml file.  Remove directories if missing.
fields.summary: Cache directory not deleted when repository removed from Fisheye

fields.description:
If a file with a hash e.g renew#global.txt committed in the perforce repository, it leads to an invalid url encoding when viewing the source file. see the attached screen shots

It also affects the following links
# Annotated 
# Reports 
# Source 
# Hide Related Revisions
# Raw

Steps to reproduce:
# Add a file to the P4 repository e.g renew#global.txt
# Go to the "Source" tab and view the source file
fields.summary: Repository link is broken when the file name with a hash in  the P4 repository

fields.description: ClearCase uses /s as part of its version numbering.  The Raw Source link includes this /s (unescaped) in the URL, so attempting to navigate to the Raw Source generates an exception.
fields.summary: Viewing Raw Source for ClearCase repository generates Exception
Per Directory LOC set to zero
Comment search for ClearCase repositories not bringing back results

fields.description: You can DOS a FE instance by supplying rediculously high resolutions to the chart URLs.
fields.summary: FE server-side charts do not sanitise x-y resolution

fields.summary: Fisheye not compatible with crowd 2.0

fields.description:
See attached screenshot.

Basically, if a directory-level property is a very long unbroken string, the FishEye GUI makes the directory property panel very wide, pushing the browse and revision log panels way off the side of the screen.

It would also be nice to have the ability to simply hide the directory properties panel, like you can with the charting panel.

Currently I use a GreaseMonkey script to simply make the box go away completely. I may try to hack the css file to make it wrap properly, if I am successful I will post the results to this issue.
fields.summary: long svn directory properties cause FishEye GUI to blow up
Error when indexing the perforce repository

fields.description: Currently, FishEye will just show the history of a specific file. Please see the attached [screenshot|^FileHistory.png] for a clearer picture. However, it would be great if FishEye can show the history of a whole branch as well.
fields.summary: Show the history of a whole branch
Rework from code reviews

fields.description: We would like the ability to use MS SQLServer as the back end database. Our other Atlassian tools (JIRA, CruiseControl) are all backed by this and we would like to consolodate our infrastructure.
fields.summary: Support an external MS SQLServer database

fields.description:
Support connecting to Confluence as a repository, with all the features available to other repositories.

The primary motivation for this feature is as an enhancement to Crucible. Crucible currently supports Confluence as a 'Light SCM' repository, but this lacks the features provided by FishEye, particularly activity streams. This would allow documentation reviews in Crucible to be on par with code reviews.
fields.summary: Support Confluence as a repository

fields.description: Create Support Zip and support request generation used to zip up the var/plugins/user directory which contained the customer's light SCM plugin configurations, however in 2.0 this seems to have changed to var/plugins/config directory.
fields.summary: Create Support Zip and create support request via mail does not include SCM Light plugin configuration from 2.0

fields.summary: Unable to clone git repository
Get ClearCase instance within Atlassian environment up and running

fields.description: Any links to Fisheye from an RSS feed entry are not absolute but relative URLs. For example for a link to a modified resource in a changeset instead of getting http://fisheye-server/browse/MyRepo/myResource#r1234 we get /browse/MyRepo/myResource#r2258. This URL cannot be opened from my RSS client (Evolution).
fields.summary: Links in RSS feed do not use absolute URLs

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Commit a binary file with spaces in the file name (e.g. Crucible User Guide .docm)
2. Navigate to Source -> <repo> -> <file name> -> Changeset -> Download File

The following message is displayed:

{noformat}
The requested resource cannot be found.
Path "branch/Crucible%20User%20Guide%20.docm" does not exist.

Referer:
    http://localhost:8060/changelog/MySVN?cs=65 

You are running release CR2.0.2 FE2.0.2 (build-412 2009-07-24), please report your release number when reporting bugs.
Got a problem or a suggestion?

Discuss it in the online forums or visit the support website for your support options.
{noformat}

The URL link in the browser is displayed as http://localhost:8060/browse/~raw%2Cr%3D65/MySVN/branch/Crucible%2520User%2520Guide%2520.docm . Please see the attached [screenshot|^DownloadFile.JPG] for a clearer picture. However, the file can be downloaded successfully when clicking on the download arrow icon. Please see the [screenshot|^ArrowLink.JPG]

When I uploaded the same file without the spaces in the filename (e.g. CrucibleUserGuide.docm), both of the 'Download File' and download arrow link are working fine. The problem seems to be related to the spaces being replaced with the %20 in the URL and hence FishEye is not able to search the corresponding file.
fields.summary: Error when downloading a binary file with space in the file name

fields.description:
{quote}
Pros for having a "Scanning" Agent approach:

    * Scaling Fisheye becomes a matter of adding an agent to scan Source Code on new hardware
    * Clients who have very large code bases can provide their own hardware to help off-set the cost of the Fisheye plant
    * Adding a new Fisheye repository will not cause all other users to suffer slow downs due to the CPU usage being used up by the scanning
{quote}

From [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-2026]

Current workaround is (which has to be done manually:

Set up a test server and add the repository there, and wait for it to finish the initial scan there. Once this is finished,

1) Shutdown test server
2) Add the repository to your production server via Administration > View Repository List > Add repo but set "Enable Immediately" to "No".
3) Copy the FISHEYE_INST/var/cache/ADDEDREPONAME directory, FISHEYE_INST/var/data/DiffTextCache/ADDEDREPONAME directory to the production server's FISHEYE_INST/var/cache and {{FISHEYE_INST/var/data/DiffTextCache directory respectively.
4) Go to Administration > View Repository List > Enable, then Start next to the repository.

This should save your production server the hassle of having to do the initial scan for the repository and the entire load is taken by your test server.
fields.summary: Allow a scan agent to complete the index of a repository on another server and copy over the cache once it is done to reduce the load on the main server.

fields.description:
When you add a repository with 0 revisions fisheye throws an error as it tries to index the first revision which doesn't exist:

{noformat}
2009-08-03 20:39:31,163 DEBUG [InitialPinger1] fisheye.app SvnThrottledClient-start - Executing info -r HEAD file:///path/to/svn/repo/@HEAD
2009-08-03 20:39:31,164 DEBUG [InitialPinger1] fisheye.app SvnThrottledClient-start - Executing log -v -r 0:HEAD file:///path/to/svn/repo/@HEAD
2009-08-03 20:39:31,164 DEBUG [InitialPinger1] fisheye.app SvnThrottledClient-start - Executing log -v -r 1:1 file:///path/to/svn/repo/@1
2009-08-03 20:39:31,165 ERROR [InitialPinger1] fisheye.app RepositoryScanner-slurp - Problem processing revisions from repo file:///path/to/svn/repo/ due to class com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException - org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: No such revision 1
com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: No such revision 1
   at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient.logMessages(SvnThrottledClient.java:130)
   at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryScanner.getRevList(SvnRepositoryScanner.java:140)
   at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.updateRevList(RepositoryScanner.java:531)
   at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.processRevisions(RepositoryScanner.java:378)
   at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.slurpRepository(RepositoryScanner.java:265)
   at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.slurp(RepositoryScanner.java:185)
{noformat}

Users may point to new svn repos before they have been commited to. 

This error should go away once the first commit is made but it would be nice to handle it. 

The work around for now is to go to Administration > View Repository List > Stop (next to your REPO) and disable the repository until the first commit is made.
fields.summary: Fisheye throws error when you add a svn repository with 0 revisions

fields.description:
Based on the documentation here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Upgrading+from+FishEye+to+Crucible

At the point 2 of 'Initial Crucible Configuration' section (The first time you run Crucible, you will be asked for a Crucible license key. You can view your license key here), Crucible actually did not ask the user for the crucible license key. It just startups as a FishEye instance where it does not have the Crucible features. 

The user needs to manually update the Crucible license via _Administration -> Sys-Info/Support_.
fields.summary: Update the documentation of 'Upgrading from FishEye to Crucible'
